Articles.Content: Got everything reinstalled, and no conflict (wierd), although i've lost all my terrain scatter at <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> now...

I'm using ETT without problems, except one thing. The RC-L01 (largest probe core) has disappeared. I've tried unlocking everything through the cheat menu to no avail, is there a way to fix this, like edit a node to include the core?

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, Black-Two- said:
> 
> 
> I'm using ETT without problems, except one thing. The RC-L01 (largest probe core) has disappeared. I've tried unlocking everything through the cheat menu to no avail, is there a way to fix this, like edit a node to include the core?
> 

Uhm.. Look at "**Probes 3**" node (the last one in Probes line, just below Computers line).

Anyway, you can try also

- uncheck **Hide unpurchased parts** checkbox in Difficulty settings / Editor settings (ingame)
- check file **\GameData\Squad\Parts\Command\probeStackLarge\probeStackLarge.cfg** for corruption
- exit KSP, delete cache files: (in game folder) **PartDatabase.cfg** and (in \GameData folder) **ModuleManager.ConfigCache**, **ModuleManager.ConfigSHA**, **ModuleManager.TechTree**. Restart KSP

Hope this helps.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-05-09T19:46:31Z" title="05/09/2017 07:46  PM" data-short="7 yr">May 9, 2017</time> by Dep**

>

I tried it, no luck. It's just in one (career) save though, in sandbox it shows up just fine.

Mods overlapping? Remove any other tech tree mods (like CTT).

Also, try search file **\GameData\ModuleManager.TechTree** for string "**probeStackLarge**" (must be 1 found) and look up for **RDNode** followed **title =** NameOfNodeWithMyDamnCore

> 
> 
> 12 minutes ago, Black-Two- said:
> 
> 
> I tried it, no luck. It's just in one (career) save though, in sandbox it shows up just fine.
> 

BTW, in **/saves/\_savename\_/\_mysave\_.sfs** check string "**TechTreeUrl =**" (value must be "**GameData/ETT/EngTechTree.cfg**")

> 
> 
> 26 minutes ago, Dep said:
> 
> 
> BTW, in **/saves/\_savename\_/\_mysave\_.sfs** check string "**TechTreeUrl =**" (value must be "**GameData/ETT/EngTechTree.cfg**")
> 

I've tried this, and the other things you mentioned, and no success. I deleted ETT instead. I don't know what else there is to do, or if I installed it wrong or something, but whatever. Thanks for trying though! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

In my (heavily modded) install, using ETT, the "Sunflower" Portable Light Kit from <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>'s MKS mod is showing up in an "Unassigned" Node, not connected to any other (but available in Career at the start) on the far left center of the tree.

> 
> 
> On 5/16/2017 at 0:40 PM, Meta Jonez said:
> 
> 
> In my (heavily modded) install, using ETT, the "Sunflower" Portable Light Kit from <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>'s MKS mod is showing up in an "Unassigned" Node, not connected to any other (but available in Career at the start) on the far left center of the tree.
> 

I posted about this in January, the part is MKS\_LightGlobe and it is in both advElectrics and Unplaced in the EngTechTree.cfg. If you remove part = MKS\_LightGlobe from the Unplaced segment it shows in advanced electrics and the floating unassigned node will be gone.

I have the same problem FWDixon was having where the tech tree sort of looks like it writes over itself.  I get a warning that there are 70 duplicate nodes when I first start KSP.  

I tried deleting the 5 files that were talked about before and that does not seem to help.  (**PartDatabase.cfg** from the KSP folder and **ModuleManager.ConfigCache**, **ModuleManager.ConfigSHA**, **ModuleManager.Physics** and **ModuleManager.TechTree** from the Game Data folder).

It seems that it is caused by KSPI-E and CTT.  When I uninstall these two mods the ETT works properly again.  I reinstall them and it goes bonkers again. 

This seems strange to me because when I first installed everything it all worked together (CTT, KSPI-E, and ETT).  However I tried to check out a different Tech tree and that's when everything went bad.  (I uninstalled that one and reinstalled ETT).   CTT works fine if ETT isn't installed and ETT works fine when CTT isn't installed.  But I don't think KSPI-E works without CTT right?  And isn't that supposed to be supported by this tree?

Is there any fix for this? 

**Edit:**  For those having a similar problem, yes, you can install KSPI-E without CTT.  I installed it manually and then deleted the CTT folder in my game data.  This worked and now everything seems happy and ETT works again.  Maybe it broke something I don't know about, but it seems to work for now.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-05-25T00:03:24Z" title="05/25/2017 12:03  AM" data-short="7 yr">May 25, 2017</time> by Minwaabi**

Next upload to <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> I will make an exclusion for CTT and mention this in the <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr>. The funny thing is I originally built the tree for personal use with KSPI-E. 

Thank you [@Minwaabi](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/91050-minwaabi/) for investigating this problem.

[@Probus](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/102512-probus/)

Do you have Hide Empty Tech Tree Nodes installed? It's probably causing the error. But yes, you can just keep the ETT or the CTT and delete the other and it will work.

To get things to work for my mod I had to use the tech tree made by Module Manager instead of whatever the vanilla ETT mod uses. This caused duplicate nodes when <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> filters aren't in properly in place, which vanilla ETT never needed. So I have a warning message display when there are duplicate nodes, just like you described. Delete the files causing the duplicate nodes, and you're good to go.
